definitions.title: n.m.dei
definitions.body: (etym. Dub. (I) Aq Sym Theod i(kano/v; Rabb [[שֶׁ־]] + [[דַּי]] (self-) sufficient, no moderns. (2) = almighty, √ [[שׁדד]] + [[י]] = Thes De Di Sta, or √[[שׁדה]] = [[שׁדד]], n. intens. Ew:§ 155 c, but [[שׁדד]] (q.v.) is deal violently not simply mightily; cf. LXX pantokra/twr 14 (15) t. (but in Pent. ´[[אלשׁ]]: is o/ Qeo/x mou, sou, etc.), Vulgate mostly omnipotens. (3) < conject. for orig. [[שֵׁדַי]] (v. [[שֵׁד]]) my sovereign lord, ‖[[אֲדׂנׇי ]], [[בעלי]] Nö:SBA 1880, 775; ZMG xlii (1888), 481; Hoffm:Ph, Inscr. 53; used of foreign deities (De 32:17), and so discredited (cf. [[בַּעַל]]).—> other conj., e.g. RS:OTJC, 424 √[[שׁדה]] pour forth (God as rain-giver); Dl:Pr 96 sq. As. šadû, high, ilu šâdû’ a, Che:Comm. Is ii.148, or šadû, mountain, also in n.pr.; v. further Dr:Ge 404 ff.);—

[[שַׁדַּי]] Nu 24:4, Nu 24:16 (JE, poem), and so as archaism Ru 1:20, Ru 1:21, Ps 68:15, Ps 91:1, Joe 1:15 = Is 13:6, Ez Eze 1:24 (del. Co); esp. Job 5:17 + 30t. Jb (+ Job 19:29 Ew Di, rdg. ´[[שׁ]]: for [[שׁדין]]).

[[אֵל שַׁדַּי]] Ge 49:25 (poem; so read for ´[[אֵת שׁ]]:, v. Sam LXX SyrVer Saad, Heb. Codd.), and so, as archaism, divine name of patriarchs in P, Ge 17:1, Ge 28:3, Ge 35:11, Ge 48:3, Ex 6:3, Ge 43:14 (R:P); so Ez Eze 10:5 (del. Co; but LXX Saddai).
